page.title: 08SKI ROSSENDALE
page.content: First ideas for a ski complex were brought before Rawtenstall Borough Council in 1969. Ski Rossendale was opened in Autumn 1973 at a cost of Â£60,000, Â£7,500 of which came from the Sports Council. In October 1979, an idea for a Regional Ski Centre at Ski Rossendale was suggested to the Rossendale Borough Council. Improvements would include extending the main ski slope to 210m, a new ski tow, extra floodlighting and the conversion and extension of a barn to provide accomodation and 'apres ski' activities. The present ski slope is about 150m long and 11m wide. Vertical drop is 35m. There are two nursery slopes about 20m by 12m. The matting is Dendix Snowslope and the tow is a button drag lift.
